EXISTING STRUCTURES
###Iron Plate Production Line at y=0.0
Consists of four stone furnaces in a row with complete automation:
- Furnace at x=0.0 (contains 20 coal, no ore, 19 iron plates)
  - Has burner inserter at x=-1.5 y=0.5 for coal input from wooden chest at x=-2.5 y=0.5 (20 coal)
  - Has burner inserter at x=0.5 y=-1.5 for ore input from wooden chest at x=0.5 y=-2.5 (19 iron plates)
- Furnace at x=2.0 (contains 20 coal, no ore, 18 iron plates)
  - Has burner inserter at x=2.5 y=-1.5 for ore input from wooden chest at x=2.5 y=-2.5 (20 coal, 20 iron plates)
  - Has output wooden chest at x=2.5 y=1.5 (empty)
  - Has output burner inserter at x=1.5 y=1.5 to move plates to the chest
- Furnace at x=4.0 (contains 22 coal, no ore, 3 iron plates)
  - Has input chest at x=4.5 y=-2.5 (20 coal, 19 iron plates)
  - Has input burner inserter at x=4.5 y=-1.5
  - Has output wooden chest at x=4.5 y=1.5 (empty)
  - Has output burner inserter at x=3.5 y=1.5
- Furnace at x=6.0 (contains 22 coal, no ore, 3 iron plates)
  - Has input chest at x=6.5 y=-2.5 (20 coal, 20 iron plates)
  - Has input burner inserter at x=6.5 y=-1.5
  - Has output wooden chest at x=6.5 y=1.5 (empty)
  - Has output burner inserter at x=5.5 y=1.5

All input inserters have been rotated to properly face UP into furnaces and configured to pick up from input chests.

ERROR TIPS
### Entity placement collision errors
- When placing inserters next to furnaces, account for the furnace's 2x2 tile size
- Use appropriate spacing parameter when placing entities next to large structures
- Check entity dimensions before attempting to place adjacent entities
- When placing chests near furnaces, ensure there is enough space between existing structures
- Consider alternative directions when initial placement fails due to entity collisions

### Resource management errors
- Check inventory before attempting to insert items into chests or entities
- Keep track of consumed resources to ensure enough materials remain for planned construction
- Consider harvesting more resources when running low before attempting insertions
- Verify you have required items in inventory before attempting to place or insert
- Ensure sufficient coal is available before attempting to fuel multiple inserters

### Inserter blocked output errors
- Multiple inserters show "output blocked by item on ground" - ensure proper output paths are clear
- Configure inserter drop positions to valid input slots on destination entities
- Set up proper output collection systems before activating input automation
- Verify inserter chains have valid end destinations before activation

### Automation efficiency
- When setting up automated systems, ensure both input and output flows are properly configured
- Test automation with small quantities before scaling up production
- Monitor inserter status messages to identify bottlenecks in the production line
- Balance input and output rates to prevent backup or resource starvation
- Ensure inserters are properly oriented for both pickup and drop-off positions

### Furnace operation
- Maintain balanced fuel and ore supplies to all furnaces
- Monitor furnace warnings and status messages to identify operation issues
- Ensure proper resource distribution across all furnaces in the production line
- Set up complete input-output chains before starting furnace operations
- Address "no ingredients to smelt" warnings by ensuring proper ore supply chain
